alert.note: Alert for Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 04 at 3:56AM MST until January 04 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 60 MPH possible. * WHERE...Lower elevations of southern Carbon County including Baggs and Saratoga. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. Winds may remain elevated through Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Snow is expected to develop by late tonight and early Wednesday morning, possibly leading to reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
